title: ECB’s Lagarde Says Euro’s Strength Is Counterintuitive, But Justified
content: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said the recent rise of the euro against the dollar is a consequence of US President Donald Trump’s erratic policies and an opportunity for Europe.

title: Portugal Holds Third Election in Three Years: What to Watch
content: Portugal holds its third election in as many years on Sunday, after Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s minority government lost a confidence vote in parliament in March.

title: Midpoint of Trump Tariff Hiatus to Reveal Increasingly Unsettled World
content: Reports in the coming week may give the fullest reading to date of how major economies are faring with trade disruptions, halfway through President Donald Trump’s 90-day hiatus on so-called reciprocal tariffs.

title: India Restricts Some Imports from Bangladesh as Ties Suffer
content: India imposed curbs on imports of ready-made garments and processed food from Bangladesh, as relations between the two neighbors turned sour in recent months.

title: Timing Not Right for China Home-Sales Overhaul: State Media
content: The timing for a nationwide housing market reform that would only allow developers to sell completed properties is “not mature,” according to China Real Estate Business, an outlet managed by China’s Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development.

title: New CLO Managers Are Pouring Into the Market
content: A spate of hedge funds and asset managers are diving into the $1.3 trillion CLO market with debut vehicles, fueling demand for new leveraged loans and pushing up prices for older ones.

title: Trump Administration Drops Southwest Scheduling Lawsuit
content: The Trump administration dropped a lawsuit against Southwest Airlines Co. that accused the airline of setting unrealistic flight schedules that led to chronic delays.

title: NJ Transit CEO Speaks Before Meeting Union Amid Strike
content: NJ Transit CEO Kris Kolluri held a presser before meeting with union on Saturday. He a said he appreciates their contribution to the agency and that his objective is to "make sure they get back to work." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Sweden as Europe's Bright Spot for Capital Markets
content: How has a nation of 10 million people built one of the most dynamic capital markets in Europe? Adena Friedman speaks with us from Stockholm on Nasdaq’s presence in the Nordic country. Sweden's minister for financial markets Niklas Wykman, Investor AB CEO Christian Cederholm, Froda CEO Olle Lundin and Swedbank CEO Jens Henriksson talk about the country's combination of social welfare and business-friendly policies that encourage risk-taking and deepen its capital markets at a time when the rest of the EU struggles to innovate and grow. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Who Has the Upper Hand in US-China Relations?
content: Former US Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers and Hoover Institution Senior Fellow Elizabeth Economy discuss the US pivot on trade dealings with China. Summers believes there’s pressure on the Chinese economy, but believes that there’s even more pressure on the US economy. Elizabeth Economy states that both the US and China have “economic vulnerabilities.”  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Turkey Makes $30 Billion Natural Gas Discovery in the Black Sea
content: Turkey has discovered 75 billion cubic meters of natural gas worth $30 billion dollars in the Black Sea, according to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title: Innovation for Growth in Sweden and for US National Defense
content: Sweden and the US Defense Department are both undergoing changes.

title: Grim Economic Outlook Overtakes Solid Earnings as Tariff Disruptions Surface
content: One thing is clear as the first-quarter earnings season draws to a close: The uncertain outlook for the global economy is superseding better-than-feared results even as stocks rally on signs of easing trade tensions.

title: ECB’s Schnabel Says ‘Steady Hand’ Needed on Interest Rates
content: The European Central Bank should remain cautious on interest-rate moves, according to Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel.

title: China Drops to No. 3 Holder of Treasuries, Behind UK
content: China shrank its holdings of US Treasuries in March, with the UK replacing it as the No. 2 overseas owner.

title: US Loses Last Top Credit Rating With Downgrade From Moody’s
content: The US was stripped of its last top credit rating by Moody’s Ratings, reflecting deepening concern that ballooning debt and deficits will damage America’s standing as the preeminent destination for global capital and increase the government’s borrowing costs.

title: Fire at Kumho Tire’s Gwangju Plant in Korea Halts Production
content: A fire broke out at Kumho Tire’s plant in Gwangju at around 7:11am Saturday, forcing the company to halt production, according to Yonhap News Agency.

title: Turkey’s Celebi Says It’s Cooperating After India Revokes Clearance
content: Turkish company Çelebi Aviation said on Saturday it’s “fully cooperating” with Indian authorities and adhering to regulations after its ground handling and cargo warehouse operations were suspended due to national security concerns.

title: AirTrunk Billionaire Buys Second Property in Sydney’s Crown: SMH
content: Founder and chief executive of Australian data center operator AirTrunk Robin Khuda and his wife Melea bought a second property in Sydney’s Crown Towers for roughly A$20 million ($12.8 million), the Sydney Morning Herald reported Saturday.

title: Stocks Fall Late on US Downgrade as Yields Climb: Markets Wrap
content: Stocks dropped in late hours and bond yields climbed after the US was downgraded by Moody’s Ratings amid concerns about the increase in government debt that threatens America’s status as the world’s safe haven.

title: Wall Street Strategists React to Moody’s US Credit Rating Cut
content: US stocks declined and Treasury yields rose after Moody’s Ratings downgraded the US credit rating, citing an increase in government debt and a higher interest burden.

title: Indian Companies, Consumers Snub Pakistan and Its Allies
content: A growing number of Indian merchants, companies, and consumers are cutting business ties with Pakistan and some of its allies after a heightened conflict between the South Asian neighbors.

title: China Pivot, Sweden's Innovation Engine, US Army Secretary Driscoll | Wall Street Week
content: This week, former US Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers and Hoover Institution's Elizabeth Economy discuss the US pivot on trade dealings with China. Plus, a look at Sweden’s vibrant capital markets and Nasdaq's role in its innovation ecosystem. Later, US Army Secretary Driscoll joins us with the administration's approach to a decades-long spending challenge at the Pentagon. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Lutnick-Built FMX to Start Treasury Futures Trade in Blow to CME
content: An exchange founded by Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick is set to start the long-awaited trading of US Treasury futures next week in a blow to CME Group Inc., which dominates that market.

title: Equities Climb Despite Inflation Angst | Bloomberg: The Close 05/16/2025
content: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are BMO Private Wealth Chief Market Strategist Carol Schleif, JPMorgan US Inflation Strategy Head Phoebe White, Seaport Research Partners Senior Analyst David Joyce, Bogg Bag Founder and CEO Kim Vaccarella, American Century Investments Multi-Asset Strategies CIO Richard Weiss, 22V Research Washington Policy Research Head Kim Wallace, PWC CTIO Matt Wood, WSL Strategic Retail CEO and Chief Shopper Wendy Liebmann, JLL Retail Advisory Services President Naveen Jaggi, Glowbar CEO and Founder Rachel Liverman (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mehvish Ayub on Trade War, Trump Administration, China Stocks
content:
Mehvish Ayub Bank of Singapore Executive Director of Investment Solutions Mehvish Ayub discusses the trade war between China and US, the Trump administration's handling of financial markets, and Chinese stocks. She speaks with Joumanna Bercetche on "Bloomberg Horizons Middle East and Africa."
 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Space, Defense Firm Voyager Technologies Files Publicly for IPO
content: Voyager Technologies Inc. filed publicly for an initial public offering, as it seeks to capitalize on rising government spending on advanced defense technologies and space exploration.

title: Monica Defend on US Dollar, Fed Cuts, Gold
content: Amundi Investment Institute Head Monica Defend discusses how they were surprised with the US Dollar as it correlated with the equity market. In an interview with Francine Lacqua she says she believes the fed will make three cuts this year, they're staying neutral on China, and overweight in gold. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Batista Brothers to Back Out of Talks for Banco Master Assets
content: Joesley and Wesley Batista, the brothers who control meat giant JBS SA through their family holding J&F Investimentos SA, are no longer in talks to acquire some of Banco Master’s assets amid lingering concerns over the lender’s financial stability, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Asian Currencies May Chart Different Paths After Recent Rally
content: Asian currencies are set to take divergent paths after a collective rally against the dollar, as investors navigate trade uncertainty and growth concerns about the world’s top two economies.

title: ECB’s Lagarde Says Euro’s Strength Is Counterintuitive, But Justified
content: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said the recent rise of the euro against the dollar is a consequence of US President Donald Trump’s erratic policies and an opportunity for Europe.

title: Portugal Holds Third Election in Three Years: What to Watch
content: Portugal holds its third election in as many years on Sunday, after Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s minority government lost a confidence vote in parliament in March.

title: Trump Plans Call With Putin to End ‘Bloodbath’ in Ukraine
content: President Donald Trump said he’ll have a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday morning to discuss how to stop the war in Ukraine.

title: Iran Sentences Three to Death Over Fatal Mosque Attacks
content: Iran handed death sentences to three individuals for allegedly participating in fatal shootings at the Shah Cheragh mosque in the southern city of Shiraz, the judiciary’s official news portal Mizan reported on Sunday.

title: India Restricts Some Imports from Bangladesh as Ties Suffer
content: India imposed curbs on imports of ready-made garments and processed food from Bangladesh, as relations between the two neighbors turned sour in recent months.

title: Polish President Vote Tests Pro-Europe Government: What to Watch
content: Poles will vote on Sunday to decide whether Prime Minister Donald Tusk gains an ally in the presidential palace to complete his bid to undo years of populist rule.

title: Canada Says Most Tariffs on US Remain, Pushing Back on Oxford Report
content: Canada’s finance minister said the government kept 25% retaliatory tariffs on tens of billions of dollars in US goods, disputing a report from a research firm that suggested it had paused the vast majority of those levies.

title: South Korean Election Frontrunner Lee Floats Two-Term Presidency
content: South Korea’s leading presidential candidate Lee Jae-myung proposed a constitutional amendment to shorten the presidency to four years with a two-term limit, calling it a move to better balance power.

title: Trump Loyalist Faces Math Prodigy in Romania Vote: What to Watch
content: Romanians elect their next president on Sunday in a contest that will determine the Black Sea nation’s trajectory in Europe as frustration with the political establishment spurs a surge in support for the far right.

title: Explosion Rocks Fertility Clinic in Palm Springs
content: The person believed responsible for an attack targeting a Southern California fertility clinic Saturday posted rambling online writings before an explosion that investigators are treating as an act of terrorism, according to a law enforcement official.

title: Fatalities Climb as Tornado, Severe Weather Sweep Through US
content: LONDON, Ky. (AP) — At least 27 people have been killed by storms systems that swept across part of the U.S. Midwest and South, with Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear announcing Saturday that 18 of the deaths came in his state and 10 others were hospitalized in critical condition.

title: Sara Duterte Wants Impeachment Trial to Go On, Sees ‘Bloodbath’
content: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte wants her impeachment trial to go ahead, days after her allies outperformed at the midterm election that could add to her bloc of supporters in the Senate.

title: Australia ‘Up for a Deal’ With the EU After Years of Trade Talks
content: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Australia is “up for a deal” with the European Union, sounding a note of cautious optimism after years of trade negotiations.

title: Beyond Nvidia, Four Things to Know at Asia’s Biggest Tech Show
content: Nvidia Corp.’s Jensen Huang headlines the 2025 edition of Asia’s biggest electronics conference, for years a showcase for his company’s cutting-edge AI chips and the companies lining up to buy them. This year, however, the spotlight may well be on another far bigger personality: US President Donald Trump.

title: UK, EU Wrangle Over Students and Travel Ahead of Reset Summit
content: British and European Union negotiators wrangled over measures to ease travel for students, young workers and tourists this weekend, as the two sides raced to resolve policy disputes ahead of a summit meant to reset their fraught relationship.

title: Merz Sees No Risk of UniCredit Taking Over Commerzbank Currently
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz currently sees no risk that Italy’s UniCredit SpA will be able to take over Commerzbank AG.

title: Meloni Says She’s No Shrink to Global Leaders as She Meets Merz
content: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni said she isn’t a “shrink to international leaders” after she was asked to give advice to German Chancellor Friedrich Merz for his upcoming trip to meet US President Donald Trump.

title: Trump Administration Drops Southwest Scheduling Lawsuit
content: The Trump administration dropped a lawsuit against Southwest Airlines Co. that accused the airline of setting unrealistic flight schedules that led to chronic delays.

title: New York Republican Floats Higher Tax Rate to Pay for SALT
content: A key House Republican who is pushing for a higher cap for state and local tax deductions sought to revive the idea of raising the top rate for high earners to help pay for President Donald Trump’s tax cuts — and to get the stalled legislation moving.

title: Arab League Summit in Baghdad Has Gaza Topping the Agenda
content: BAGHDAD (AP) — Arab leaders at an annual summit in Baghdad called Saturday for an immediate end to Israel's attacks on the Gaza Strip and to allow aid into the Palestinian territories without conditions. They promised to contribute to the reconstruction of the territory once the war stops.

title: Trump Says Walmart Shouldn’t Blame Tariffs for Higher Prices
content: President Donald Trump said Walmart Inc. should stop trying to blame tariffs as the reason for raising its prices, as the company warned it would this week.

title: US Says It’s Not Decided Next Steps on NYC’s Congestion Pricing
content: The Trump administration urged a federal judge to refrain from blocking the government from taking any action against New York’s congestion pricing program, saying it hasn’t actually done anything yet.

title: Trump Says Will Be Speaking to Putin of Russia on Monday
content: President Donald Trump says he will be speaking to President Putin on Monday at 10am.

title: Iran’s Khamenei Brands Trump a Liar in Escalation of Rhetoric
content: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei accused US President Donald Trump of dishonesty and power abuse, marking the latest rhetorical flare-up between Tehran and the US.

title: Israel Starts Gaza Escalation, Sees Movement in Hostage Talks
content: Israel advanced its ground forces in Gaza as part of a long-threatened all-out offensive against Hamas, and said the new action prompted the group to resume mediated negotiations on a possible ceasefire and hostage release.

title: Trump’s Deals Cast China Both as Foe and Prize, Blurring Signals
content: Pick through the details of recent US trade negotiations and an outline of Donald Trump’s vision for the global economy starts to come into focus. As do its contradictions.

content: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is looking for Washington to ease defense sanctions on his country as ties warm up between the NATO allies under the new US administration.

title: North Macedonia Forges £5 Billion Investment Alliance With UK
content: North Macedonia is set to receive as much as £5 billion ($6.6 billion) in funding from the UK to support investment in infrastructure and other key sectors, Prime Minister Hristijan Mickoski told reporters in Skopje on Saturday.

title: Nissan Plans to Close Plants in Japan, Mexico, Yomiuri Says
content: Nissan Motor Co. plans to close two factories in Japan, as well as locations in four other countries as part of its restructuring and cost-cutting process, the Yomiuri newspaper and other news outlets reported, citing unidentified sources.

title: Abrego Garcia Judge Frustrated at US Not Answering Questions
content: A federal judge repeatedly expressed frustration Friday at the Trump administration’s failure to answer her questions about what it is doing to facilitate the return of a Maryland resident wrongly deported to a notorious prison in his native El Salvador.

title: Beyond Nvidia, Four Things to Know at Asia’s Biggest Tech Show
content: Nvidia Corp.’s Jensen Huang headlines the 2025 edition of Asia’s biggest electronics conference, for years a showcase for his company’s cutting-edge AI chips and the companies lining up to buy them. content: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang expressed confidence in his company’s trade partners and said there’s no evidence of its prized semiconductors being diverted to the Chinese market.

title: OpenAI, Oracle to Help UAE Develop Massive Data Center
content: OpenAI plans to help develop a massive new data center in the United Arab Emirates that may eventually be one of the largest in the world, a major bet on the Middle East and a significant expansion of the company’s global AI infrastructure ambitions.

title: Epic Asks Court to Force Apple to Approve Fortnite on US Store
content: Epic Games Inc. asked a court to force Apple Inc. to approve access to the hit game Fortnite in the US App Store, the latest tussle in a long-running feud over Apple’s control of game distribution revenue.

title: Tesla Moves to Stymie Shareholder Lawsuits After Musk Pay Saga
content: Tesla Inc. took a step to prevent future shareholder lawsuits like the one that blocked a record-setting pay package for Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk.

title: CoreWeave Jumps to Record After Nvidia Reports Larger Stake
content: CoreWeave Inc. shares surged 22% to a record high on Friday after Nvidia Corp. reported a larger-than-anticipated stake in the cloud-computing provider.

title: Coinbase Boosted by S&P 500 Inclusion Despite Hack, Probe Risks
content: Coinbase Global Inc.’s rally has been unconquerable this week, as even a one-two punch of negative headlines did little to stop the crypto exchange operator’s climb ahead of its inclusion in the S&P 500 Index.

title: Charter and Cox Combine in $34.5 Billion Cable Deal
content: Charter Communications and Cox Communications, two of the largest US cable providers, agree to combine in a deal worth $34.5 billion. Bloomberg’s Michelle Davis explains why this deal has been years in the making, speaking with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Prosus CEO Defends Offer for Just Eat Takeaway
content: Prosus CEO Fabricio Bloisi explains how the company is using M&A in its ambition to become the biggest tech lifestyle company outside the US and Asia. Bloisi joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Verizon Wins FCC Nod for Frontier Deal After Ditching DEI
content: Verizon Communications Inc. won Federal Communications Commission approval for its $9.6 billion acquisition of Frontier Communications Parent Inc. after agreeing to agency demands to pare back diversity initiatives in line with President Donald Trump’s policies.

title: Airbnb Aims to Boost Revenue with New Services, Ads
content: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky discusses why the vacation rental company overhauled its app and is refocusing on events and services. Chesky outlines the revenue opportunities for Airbnb with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Amazon Removed Backup Landing Sensors Before Drone Crashes
content: Retaining the technology could have prevented the aircraft from accidentally shutting off their propellers midflight and plummeting to the ground.

title: Microsoft Will Need to Take on OpenAI to Hit AI Goals
content: Bloomberg’s Austin Carr discusses his conversation with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and why the tech boss says AI will remake every business. Carr joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Coinbase Hack Could Have Wide-Ranging Impact
content: Crypto trading platform Coinbase said a hacker demanded $20 million to delete illegally obtained customer data. Bloomberg’s Margi Murphy explains how the hacker gained access to Coinbase's customer information and the potential cost of the incident. She speaks with Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Globant Suffers Record Intraday Drop as Tariffs Dent Earnings
content: Software company Globant SA suffered a record intraday decline after blaming its disappointing first-quarter results on the ripple effects of US tariffs.

title: Tech Investors Digest Trump’s Week in the Middle East
content: Ipek Ozkardeskaya, Swissquote Senior Analyst, discusses how markets are reacting to tech deals announced during President Trump’s visit to the Gulf. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Coinbase Hack Highlights How Greed Can Overwhelm Cyber Defenses
content: Following cybersecurity best practices doesn’t always protect against human greed.

title: Cinven Taps Goldman, UBS for €6 Billion Ufinet Sale
content: Private equity firm Cinven has selected Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and UBS Group AG to arrange a sale of telecom operator Ufinet Group, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Trump’s Week in the Gulf, Airbnb's App Redesign | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss President Trump’s tech-focused trip to the Middle East. Plus, Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky explains the revenue opportunity the company sees in services as it launches a redesigned app. And Prosus CEO Fabricio Bloisi says partnerships and acquisitions are part of the company’s efforts to become the biggest tech lifestyle company outside the US or China. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Video Game Makers Turn Back to Kickstarter in Tough Funding Climate
content: With investors closing their wallets, some indie studios are once again looking to crowdfunding

title: FTC Rests at Meta Monopoly Trial, Shifting Focus to Defense
content: The Federal Trade Commission wrapped up its case Thursday for breaking up Meta Platforms Inc. as an illegal social-media monopoly, with the company now set to lay out its defense in the ongoing antitrust trial.

title: Coinbase Hackers Use Bribery to Grease the Wheels to Access Client Data
content: Brian Armstrong, chief executive officer of Coinbase Global Inc., speaks during a "Stand With Crypto" get out the vote rally at The Bourbon Room in Los Angeles, California, US, on Monday, March 4, 2024. California's Senate race is living up to its jungle primary nickname and turning out to be one of the most competitive in the nation, featuring crypto billionaire donors and a former star baseball player.

title: European Stocks Post Fifth Week of Gains as Trade Tensions Ease
content: European stocks wrapped up a fifth straight week of gains with investors focused on US trade negotiations, while the corporate earnings season has turned out better than expected.

title: OpenAI Takes on Google, Anthropic With New AI Agent for Coders
content: OpenAI is rolling out a new artificial intelligence agent for ChatGPT users that’s designed to help streamline software development as the company pushes into a crowded market of startups and large tech firms offering AI tools for coders.

title: Applied Materials Slides After Giving Disappointing Forecast
content: Applied Materials Inc. shares fell as much as 7.3% after the chip-equipment maker gave a lackluster forecast for the current period, highlighting the potential cost of the US trade dispute with China.

title: Premier League Sponsors Exit UK After Gaming Watchdog Probe
content: Six betting websites that sponsor UK Premier League football clubs have ceased their UK operations after an investigation by the country’s gambling regulator into their licensing partner.

title: Ratos Weighs IPO of Nordic Construction Unit Sentia
content: Swedish conglomerate Ratos AB is considering listing its construction arm Sentia, according to people familiar with the matter, marking another potential initial public offering for the Nordic region.

title: Nvidia Shares Roar Back as Clouds Hanging Over Chipmaker Fade
content: After several months in the wilderness, Nvidia Corp. shares have found their way again as doubts about Big Tech spending subside, trade tensions with China ease, and new chip buyers emerge.

title: Pinterest Is in Talks to Lease Offices at NYC’s 11 Madison Tower
content: Pinterest Inc. is in talks to take office space at Manhattan’s 11 Madison Ave.

title: Lidar Maker Hesai Is Said to Confidentially File for Hong Kong Listing
content: China’s Hesai Group, the world’s largest maker of lidar sensors used in driver assistance systems, has confidentially filed for a Hong Kong listing, according to people familiar with the matter.

content: Portugal holds its third election in as many years on Sunday, after Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s minority government lost a confidence vote in parliament in March.

title: Midpoint of Trump Tariff Hiatus to Reveal Increasingly Unsettled World
content: Reports in the coming week may give the fullest reading to date of how major economies are faring with trade disruptions, halfway through President Donald Trump’s 90-day hiatus on so-called reciprocal tariffs.

title: India Restricts Some Imports from Bangladesh as Ties Suffer
content: India imposed curbs on imports of ready-made garments and processed food from Bangladesh, as relations between the two neighbors turned sour in recent months.

title: Canada Says Most Tariffs on US Remain, Pushing Back on Oxford Report
content: Canada’s finance minister said the government kept 25% retaliatory tariffs on tens of billions of dollars in US goods, disputing a report from a research firm that suggested it had paused the vast majority of those levies.

title: Australia ‘Up for a Deal’ With the EU After Years of Trade Talks
content: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Australia is “up for a deal” with the European Union, sounding a note of cautious optimism after years of trade negotiations.

title: UK, EU Wrangle Over Students and Travel Ahead of Reset Summit
content: British and European Union negotiators wrangled over measures to ease travel for students, young workers and tourists this weekend, as the two sides raced to resolve policy disputes ahead of a summit meant to reset their fraught relationship.

title: US Says It’s Not Decided Next Steps on NYC’s Congestion Pricing
content: The Trump administration urged a federal judge to refrain from blocking the government from taking any action against New York’s congestion pricing program, saying it hasn’t actually done anything yet.

title: Trump’s Deals Cast China Both as Foe and Prize, Blurring Signals
content: Pick through the details of recent US trade negotiations and an outline of Donald Trump’s vision for the global economy starts to come into focus. As do its contradictions.

title: Saudi Arabia Plays Trump Card in US-China Dance
content: A 1945 meeting between President Franklin D. Roosevelt and King Abdulaziz Al Saud might be regarded as something of interest only to modern-history buffs. But this week, images of that pivotal tête-à-tête between the US and Saudi leaders circulated in news and social media as President Donald Trump visited the Middle East.

title: Charting the Global Economy: US, China Forecasts Improve on Tariff Truce
content: Economists marked up their forecasts for growth in the US and China after the world’s two-largest economies reached a temporary agreement to reduce tariffs on each other.

title: ECB’s Schnabel Says ‘Steady Hand’ Needed on Interest Rates
content: The European Central Bank should remain cautious on interest-rate moves, according to Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel.

title: US Loses Last Top Credit Rating With Downgrade From Moody’s
content: The US was stripped of its last top credit rating by Moody’s Ratings, reflecting deepening concern that ballooning debt and deficits will damage America’s standing as the preeminent destination for global capital and increase the government’s borrowing costs.

title: Bank of England Forecast Shake-Up Risks Sowing Market Confusion
content: Former Bank of England ratesetters are warning that a planned shake-up of the central bank’s forecast and communications strategy risks sowing confusion in financial markets and weakening debate among policymakers.

title: Indian Companies, Consumers Snub Pakistan and Its Allies
content: A growing number of Indian merchants, companies, and consumers are cutting business ties with Pakistan and some of its allies after a heightened conflict between the South Asian neighbors.

title: Grim Outlooks Take Centerstage as Tariffs Loom: Earnings Watch
content: One thing is clear as the first-quarter earnings season draws to a close: The uncertain outlook for the global economy is superseding better-than-feared results even as stocks rally on signs of easing trade tensions.

title: Chicago Taps EY to Close $1 Billion Gap as Trump Threatens Funds
content: Chicago is hiring Ernst & Young LLP to help the city slash costs and close budget gaps that are forecast to top $1 billion in each of the next two years.

title: Fed to Shrink Staff by About 10% Over Next Several Years
content: The Federal Reserve plans to shrink its system-wide workforce by about 10% over the next couple of years, mainly through attrition.

title: UK Visa Scams Squeeze Millions From Would-Be Care Workers
content: Recent changes to immigration policy won’t do anything for people who’ve been exploited while seeking jobs in the UK. But they may worsen the care-worker shortage.

title: Russian Inflation Steadies as Key Rate Cut Expectations Build
content: Price growth in Russia halted its acceleration in April for the first time in six months, bolstering the case for kicking off long-awaited monetary easing amid signs of a sharp economic slowdown.

title: US Consumer Sentiment Nears Record Low on Inflation Concerns
content: US consumer sentiment unexpectedly fell to the second-lowest level on record and inflation expectations climbed to multi-decade highs amid growing concerns about tariffs.

title: ECB Will Include Trade Scenarios in June Projections, Lane Says
content: The European Central Bank will publish additional scenarios for the euro-zone economy alongside next month’s quarterly outlook in an attempt to capture the possible effects of the current trade turmoil, according to Chief Economist Philip Lane.

title: Bernanke Urges Fed to Adopt ‘Alternative’ Forecast Scenarios
content: Former Federal Reserve Chair Ben S. Bernanke urged the US central bank to provide the public a fuller explanation of its interest-rate decisions and a much richer examination of potential forecast scenarios.

title: Price Hikes Are Beginning to Threaten the American Consumer
content: For all the worry about tariffs causing pain for American consumers, shoppers have so far been mostly shielded from — or shrugged off — higher prices at the checkout aisle.

title: What a Weaker US Dollar Means for the Economy
content: American exporters would benefit from the currency’s drop, but consumers could feel a pinch.

title: US Housing Starts Increase on Pickup in Multifamily Construction
content: US housing starts increased in April as a pickup in multifamily home construction more than offset a decline in single-family dwellings caused by elevated inventory.

title: Romania Holds Interest Rates Before Tight Presidential Vote
content: Romania’s central bank kept borrowing costs unchanged just days before a presidential runoff that may determine prospects for tackling a budget crisis after months of political turmoil and a market selloff.

title: Trump Says US to Set Tariff Rates for Other Nations in Weeks
content: President Donald Trump said he would set tariff rates for US trading partners “over the next two to three weeks,” saying his administration lacks the capacity to negotiate deals with all of its trading partners.

title: Swiss Had Good Exchange With US on Currency, SNB Chief Says
content: Switzerland has had productive talks with the US on the central bank’s currency interventions, Swiss National Bank President Martin Schlegel said, rejecting the suggestion that the country manipulates the franc’s exchange rate.

title: Bessent Sees New Financial Forces Strengthening Economy, Dollar
content: I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the US Treasury secretary’s endorsements of private credit and stablecoins. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: FDA Approves Novavax Covid-19 Shot With Unusual Restrictions
content: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Food and Drug Administration has issued a long-awaited approval of Novavax’s COVID-19 vaccine but with unusual restrictions.

title: CATL Shrugs Off US Blacklisting for Blockbuster Hong Kong Debut
content: A Pentagon blacklisting, US congressional scrutiny and a global trade war haven’t been enough to stop the world’s largest maker of electric-car batteries from completing the globe’s biggest share sale so far this year.

title: Merz Sees No Risk of UniCredit Taking Over Commerzbank Currently
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz currently sees no risk that Italy’s UniCredit SpA will be able to take over Commerzbank AG.

title: Turkey Makes $30 Billion Natural Gas Discovery in the Black Sea
content: Turkey has discovered 75 billion cubic meters of natural gas worth $30 billion dollars in the Black Sea, according to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title: North Macedonia Forges £5 Billion Investment Alliance With UK
content: North Macedonia is set to receive as much as £5 billion ($6.6 billion) in funding from the UK to support investment in infrastructure and other key sectors, Prime Minister Hristijan Mickoski told reporters in Skopje on Saturday.

title: Taiwan Shuts Last Nuclear Reactor as Energy Debate Heats Up
content: Taiwan started to shut its final nuclear reactor on Saturday as a 40-year operating license expired, in a move that could threaten the island’s energy security and climate goals.

title: Nissan Plans to Close Plants in Japan, Mexico, Yomiuri Says
content: Nissan Motor Co. plans to close two factories in Japan, as well as locations in four other countries as part of its restructuring and cost-cutting process, the Yomiuri newspaper and other news outlets reported, citing unidentified sources.

title: Tesla Moves to Stymie Shareholder Lawsuits After Musk Pay Saga
content: Tesla Inc. took a step to prevent future shareholder lawsuits like the one that blocked a record-setting pay package for Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk.

title: FAA Seeks Cap on Newark Airport Flights After Airline Talks
content: US aviation safety regulators proposed temporarily limiting flights at Newark airport to no more than 28 arrivals per hour after a pair of radar and radio outages fueled major disruptions in recent weeks.

title: FDA Clears First Blood Test to Diagnose Alzheimer’s Disease
content: US regulators have approved the first blood test to help diagnose Alzheimer’s disease, potentially making it easier to find and treat patients with the mind-robbing disease that affects nearly 7 million Americans.

title: Progressive NYC Private School Fighting Foreclosure Files Bankruptcy
content: Manhattan Country School, an Upper West Side private school promoting social justice and a progressive academic curriculum that is battling possible foreclosure, has filed bankruptcy.

title: Driverless Trucking Firm Aurora Puts Human Back in Driver’s Seat
content: Driverless vehicle developer Aurora Innovation Inc. is putting a human back in front of the wheel of big rigs operating in Texas, reversing course less than three weeks after the company began commercial autonomous service there.

title: Weight-Loss Drug Craze Boosts $80 Billion Lilly Endowment to Largest in US
content: The endowment started by the founding family of drugmaker Eli Lilly saw its assets surge to $80 billion at the end of 2024, passing Bill Gates’ foundation for the top spot.

title: Grim Outlooks Take Centerstage as Tariffs Loom: Earnings Watch
content: One thing is clear as the first-quarter earnings season draws to a close: The uncertain outlook for the global economy is superseding better-than-feared results even as stocks rally on signs of easing trade tensions.

title: Banco do Brasil Rout Sheds $3.7 Billion as Guidance Pulled
content: Banco do Brasil SA shed 21 billion reais ($3.7 billion) in market value Friday in its worst session in five years after the Brazilian lender put parts of its 2025 forecast under review and reported rising delinquency rates on agricultural loans that took a bite out of first-quarter profit.

title: Walmart Names Company Veteran to Oversee International Growth
content: Walmart Inc. selected a company veteran to fill a newly created role that aims to spark international growth, as the world’s largest retailer looks to bolster its overseas operations.

title: Chobani Enters Ready-to-Eat Meal Market With Daily Harvest Deal
content: Chobani LLC bought ready-to-eat meal maker Daily Harvest Inc. for an undisclosed amount as it continues its expansion beyond yogurt into more areas of the grocery store.

title: Wells Fargo, BofA Lead $650 Million Refinancing for Boston Tower
content: A newly built office tower in downtown Boston has landed a $650 million refinancing.

title: Novo CEO Was Blindsided on Call by Chairman Before His Departure
content: When Novo Nordisk A/S Chief Executive Officer Lars Fruergaard Jorgensen dialed into a Teams video call with Chairman Helge Lund, he was expecting an ordinary catchup.

title: US Weighs Dropping Boeing Crash Charge, Victims’ Lawyers Say
content: The US Justice Department is considering an agreement that would allow Boeing Co. to avoid a criminal charge for two fatal crashes of its 737 Max jets, according to lawyers representing family members of the victims.

title: Ted Leonsis Wants to Give You Non-Stop Sport All Year Round
content: We’ve got plenty of news for you this week. A triathlon organizer is raising money; we tell you how much Chelsea’s women’s team is now worth; and we sit down with multi-team owner Ted Leonsis (just before the Washington Capitals lost in the Stanley Cup playoffs) to hear how his building plans are going and his thoughts on the future of how we watch sports.

title: Starmer Vows to Fight Scams Targeting Migrant Care Workers
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer is “absolutely committed” to stamping out scams targeted at aspiring migrants after a Bloomberg Businessweek investigation revealed widespread fraud in the UK’s Health and Care Worker visa route.

title: Novo CEO’s Shock Exit: Who Will Take Over Obesity Drug Giant?
content: Novo Nordisk A/S’s surprise decision to replace Chief Executive Officer Lars Fruergaard Jorgensen has triggered a race to fill a role that is almost never available: the winner will be only its fourth leader since 1981.

title: US Measles Cases Grow 2.3% in a Week as Outbreak Appears to Slow
content: The US reported 23 new confirmed measles cases on Friday, a 2.3% increase from the week prior as the spread of the highly contagious virus appears to be slowing.

title: US Shopper Retreat From Temu, Shein Boosts Macy’s, Kohl’s, Gap
content: US department stores and discount chains are benefiting as consumers pull back from Chinese marketplaces Temu and Shein, which have watched their momentum crater since the US closed a tariff loophole that had helped them flourish.

title: ICC Prosecutor Steps Down Pending Probe of Alleged Misconduct
content: Karim Khan, the chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court, has taken a leave of absence pending the outcome of a probe into his alleged misconduct.

title: London Landlord Workspace Warns of Vacancies Hitting Profit
content: Workspace Group Plc, a landlord that rents space on flexible terms to mostly small- and medium-sized London businesses, has warned that rising vacancies in its portfolio will dent profits.

title: MEG Energy Holders Pan ‘Laughable’ Strathcona Takeover Bid
content: Some MEG Energy Corp. shareholders say they’re unimpressed with a potential takeover offer from rival oil producer Strathcona Resources Ltd.

title: Price Hikes Are Beginning to Threaten the American Consumer
content: For all the worry about tariffs causing pain for American consumers, shoppers have so far been mostly shielded from — or shrugged off — higher prices at the checkout aisle.

title: PHP Sweetens Bid for Rival Assura as It Seeks to Unseat KKR
content: Primary Health Properties Plc has made a revised cash and share offer for rival healthcare landlord Assura Plc that values the company at about £1.68 billion ($2.2 billion).

title: Moody’s Downgrades U.S. Credit Rating Below Triple-A
content: Now all three major credit rating firms no longer give the United States their best rating.

title: Moody's downgrades U.S. credit rating, citing rising government debt
content: Moody's lowered its rating on U.S. debt from Aaa to Aa1, pointing to sustained increase in federal debt and interest payments.

title: Moody's strips U.S. government of top credit rating
content: Moody’s Ratings stripped the U.S. government of its top credit rating Friday, citing successive governments’ failure to stop a rising tide of debt.

title: Want to qualify for credit card debt forgiveness? Watch these 3 things.
content: Thinking about applying for credit card debt forgiveness in today's economy? Start by inspecting these three items.

title: Can you legally stop paying your credit cards?
content: Before you stop paying, you should understand the risks and the possible legal consequences of doing so.

title: World Press Photo Suspends Nick Ut's Credit on 'Napalm Girl'
content: World Press Photo has suspended Nick Ut's authorship of Napalm Girl after a documentary claimed that he did not take the famous photo.

title: Moody’s Slashes US’ Credit Rating
content: Moody’s was the final major ratings agency that gave the U.S. a triple-A credit rating.

title: Naked Gun Co-Creator Shares Thoughts On Liam Neeson's Reboot, And Explains Why He Turned Down A Producer Credit
content: Naked Gun co-creator David Zucker admits he turned down a producer's credit over disapproval of the new reboot, while also sharing details of a rejected pitch.

title: Can I still use my credit card after debt settlement?
content: The answer to that question isn't as straightforward as you might want, but the situation isn't hopeless, either.

title: Taking Credit for Bronny James & Caitlin Clark’s Success, Ex-NBA Star Admits Real Reason Behind NIL Boost
content: Ex-NBA star named the man behind the NIL boost after taking credit for Bronny James and Caitlin Clark's one success

title: SEC’s Anti-Fraud Public Service Campaign Warns Investors About Relationship Investment Scams
content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

title: By Building Wealth, Investors Power U.S. Economy
content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

content:

content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will hold four more roundtables in its ongoing series discussing crypto asset regulation.

content:

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that it has filed charges against David Yow Shang Chiueh of East Hanover, New Jersey and his investment advisory firm, Upright Financial Corp., for misconduct and for investing more than 25…

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a six-month extension of the compliance dates for amendments adopted in September 2023 to the Investment Company Act “Names Rule,” which addresses fund names likely to mislead investors about a fund’…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Roundtable on Security Status
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

content:

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the members of the Crypto Task Force staff, which is advising the Commission on matters related to crypto.

title: Proofpoint To Buy Hornetsecurity For Around $1B
content: Cybersecurity company Proofpoint announced that it plans to acquire Hornetsecurity, a security provider specialized in Microsoft 365 software tools, in a deal reportedly valued at around $1 billion.

title: Venture Capital’s Second(ary) Chance
content: The lack of a healthy exit market is an existential problem for the venture capital industry, writes guest author Dan Gray, who sees the evolving strategy of secondary markets as one solution.

title: DFJ Growth Closes $1.2B Flagship Fund
content: Venture investor DFJ Growth announced it has raised $1.2 billion for a fifth flagship fund, its largest to date.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
